channel.title: Reason for auto restart
channel.description:
For some unknown reason my server restarted last night while I was sleeping. I know this because all my applications were stopped and the uptime displayed by the command uptime is about 4 hours.
I want to find out what caused this though, because it could have been something nasty like a hardware failure. I know it wasn't a power failure because my digital clock would be whining at me to set the time. Maybe it's normal for ubuntu to shut down now and again for updates?
Oh and a site activity logging MySQL table crashed and had to be repaired. This could have been caused by the prompt shutdown itself though, not necessarily a hard disk fart.

item.title: Reason for auto restart
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:9, topic:322094”][quote author=inertia link=topic=418518.msg3077602#msg3077602 date=1261952983]

Power fluctuation? Try hooking it up to an UPS.

As I say, my digital clock would have been flashing if the power went. The server is on a surge protection socket though, maybe that had something to do with it.

As mopman says, it’s probably not worth bothering with if it never happens again, I just thought there may have been a logged reason.
[/quote]
Actually, computer power supplies are much more sensitive than clocks. I had my workstation randomly reboot during the night (and other appliances were fine) and when I attached an UPS it was fine.[/quote]

Oh right yeh… it could have been the psu or something detecting a small power fluctuation. That was probably it if the logs do not show any shutdown scripts, do the logs show any shutdown scripts?

If it keeps happening I’ll have to live with it because I can’t afford a UPS.

There’s a lot of activity around the hours it went down. I’m having trouble making sense of it though…

Dec 26 04:24:15 server kernel: [3387955.207236] eth0: link down
Dec 26 04:24:51 server syslogd 1.5.0#1ubuntu1: restart.

Lost ethernet connection so restart system? Right… So then it does a load of shit which I imagine is the shutdown script log, then the startup log. Then a bit later:

Dec 26 04:44:51 server -- MARK --
Dec 26 05:04:51 server -- MARK --
Dec 26 05:24:51 server -- MARK --
Dec 26 05:43:22 server syslogd 1.5.0#1ubuntu1: restart.

Ok, so the server is alright up to 5:43 where it decides to restart again… More shutdown scripts blah blah… more restarts, more eth0 down etc etc. Makes no sense to me

I know it’s probably okay but most of my hardware is quite old and if there’s a problem I want to fix it now rather than when it causes significant downtime and I have to wait for parts etc.

Edit, googling ‘syslogd 1.5.0#1ubuntu1: restart.’ has informed me that this is the log rotating files. No idea why my server restarted now :S It’s funny how I see that message just before the shutdown scripts show though.
